meanings.definition: The office or position of a praetor.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, the praetorship was a prestigious role in government.
meanings.sent2: During the Roman Republic, individuals competed for the praetorship to gain political power.
meanings.sent3: The praetorship seemed like a challenging puzzle to solve for the ambitious young senator.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work transformed her role into a praetorship of influence within the company.
meanings.sent5: The responsibilities of the praetorship weighed heavily on his shoulders as he navigated the political landscape.

meanings.definition: The term of office of a praetor.
meanings.sent1: After being elected, his praetorship lasted for one year.
meanings.sent2: The praetorship of Marcus Aurelius was marked by stability and justice.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected challenges during his praetorship made for an interesting chapter in Roman history.
meanings.sent4: Her praetorship was a beacon of integrity in a sea of corruption.
meanings.sent5: The end of his praetorship signaled a new era for the city.
